intro: Psoralea margaretiflora, commonly known as Margaret’s psoralea, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a small shrub with hairy, compound leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
